column3: Technical measures required/followed when processing data of the declared category

column3: Technical measures consisting of pseudoanonymization and encryption

column3: Encryption of data when being stored (persistent encryption)
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Encryption of data in transit e.g. when being transferred from one location to another, including sharing
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: PseudoAnonmyization or 'pseudonymisationâ€™ means the processing of personal data in such a manner that the personal data can no longer be attributed to a specific data subject without the use of additional information, provided that such additional information is kept separately and is subject to technical and organisational measures to ensure that the personal data are not attributed to an identified or identifiable natural person;
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Conversion of identifiable personal data (PII) to un-identifiable personal data
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Altering personal data irreversibly such that a data subject can no longer be identified directly or indirectly, either by the data controller alone or in collaboration with any other party
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Methods which restrict access to a place or resource
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Protocols involving validation of identity i.e. authentication of a person or information
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Restrictions required or followed regarding storage of data
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Duration or temporal entity denoting limitation on storage of personal data
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Location or geospatial scope where the data is stored
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Deletion or Erasure of data including any deletion guarantees
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Regularity and temporal span of data restoration/backup mechanisms that guarantee that data is preserved

column3: Organisational measures required/followed when processing data of the declared category
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Risk management refers to a coordinated set of activities and methods that is used to direct an organization and to control the many risks that can affect its ability to achieve objectives.  The term risk management also refers to the programme that is used to manage risk. This programme includes risk management principles, a risk management framework, and a risk management process.
column7: Data Protection Impact Assessments as per GDPR art 35, other Privacy Impact Assessments, threat severity assessment https://www.cnil.fr/en/privacy-impact-assessment-pia
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar
